fs.fibu2.data.model
Class Category

java.lang.Object
  fs.fibu2.data.model.Category
All Implemented Interfaces:
XMLConfigurable, java.lang.Comparable<Category>
public final class Category
extends java.lang.Object
implements XMLConfigurable, java.lang.Comparable<Category>

Implements a category specification for fsfibu2 entries. A category is a sequence of strings, where latter strings specify a more detailed category (e.g. 'Living being' - 'Animal' - 'Fish' - 'Shark'). Category objects are immutable and there is only one category object for each category, so there is no public constructor. The root category is represented by the empty list.
Though this class implements XMLConfigurable, only read access is allowed. Any call of configure() will cause an XMLWriteConfiurationException

Author:
Simon Hampe

isSubCategoryOf

public boolean isSubCategoryOf(Category p)
Returns:
Whether this category is a subcategory of p, i.e. p is a (direct or indirect) parent of this category. If p == null, this returns false.

isSuperCategoryOf

public boolean isSuperCategoryOf(Category c)
Returns:
Whether this category is a supercategory of c, i.e. is a (direct or indirect) parent of c.

getGreatestCommonParent

public Category getGreatestCommonParent(Category o)
Finds the greatest (in terms of order) category, such that both this category and o are subcategories of it. if o == null, this returns the root category

equals

Returns true, if and only if obj == this. This works, since there is only one object for each category.

insertMyPreferences

public void insertMyPreferences(java.util.prefs.Preferences node)
Will first remove any 'tail' node it finds and then insert a recursive sequence of 'tail' nodes for each element of the category sequence and within each tail node a key value pair ('tail', ...) indicating the actual value in the sequence

createFromPreferences

public static Category createFromPreferences(java.util.prefs.Preferences node)
Creates a category from the given node. For each node named 'tail' in node it obtains the value of the key 'tail' in this node and appends it to the string sequence defining the resulting category. As soon as this node does not exist or the key does not exist, the process ends and the resulting category is returned

getCategory

public static Category getCategory(org.dom4j.Node n)
Returns:
A category with a sequence element for each 'tail' node / The root category for the null node

compareTo

public int compareTo(Category o)
Establishes an order on categories.
- null is smaller than any category
- The root category is the minimal category
- Every category is larger than each of its supercategories
- If two categories A,B are not subcategories of one another, then let l be the largest order such that A_upto_l = B_upto_l and then A <= B iff A.(l+1) <= B.(l+1) in terms of lexicographical order, where A_upto_l denotes the category defined by the first l strings and A.(l+1) denotes the l+1-st string

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Category>
Returns:
x>0,0,x<0 depending on whether this category is larger than, equal to or less than o
